title: Secondary Air Injection Solenoid - Removal (if fitted)

body.body: Secondary Air Injection Solenoid - Removal (if fitted)
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Fuel Tank Removal D74; DF4; DG4; DR4; DS4
Note that the fixing for the solenoid valve bracket also secures the rear of the ignition coil bracket to the frame for installation.
Note the routing of the solenoid hoses for installation.
Release the fixing and detach the solenoid valve and its bracket from the frame.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the solenoid valve.
Release the spring-close clamps, detach the two hoses and remove the solenoid valve and bracket assembly.

body.name: Secondary Air Injection Solenoid Valve ckke

body.body: If required, slide the solenoid valve off its mounting bracket.

metadata.products: DTC; DCZ; DPZ; D34; DX4; DW4; DW; D74; DR4; DS4; DU4; DT4; DD4; D64; D54; DB4; DP4; DC4; DG4; DF4; DVY; DB; DVX; DV; DUY; DU; DB2

search: Secondary Air Injection Solenoid - Removal (if fitted)
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Note that the fixing for the solenoid valve bracket also secures the rear of the ignition coil bracket to the frame for installation.
Note the routing of the solenoid hoses for installation.
Release the fixing and detach the solenoid valve and its bracket from the frame.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the solenoid valve.
Release the spring-close clamps, detach the two hoses and remove the solenoid valve and bracket assembly.
If required, slide the solenoid valve off its mounting bracket.
